title: Voltage across capacitors as dielectric removed

content.question: Two identical capacitors, Y and Z, are connected in series with an ideal battery, as shown in figure 1 above, and fully charged. Each capacitor has a dielectric slab of dielectric constant ðœ… > 1 between its plates. If the dielectric slab is removed from capacitor Z, which of the following describes what happens to the voltage across each capacitor?

choices.label: Voltage across Capacitor Y: IncreasesVoltage across Capacitor Z: Decreases
Voltage across Capacitor Y: IncreasesVoltage across Capacitor Z: Increases
Voltage across Capacitor Y: Remains the sameVoltage across Capacitor Z: Remains the same
Voltage across Capacitor Y: DecreasesVoltage across Capacitor Z: Decreases
Voltage across Capacitor Y: DecreasesVoltage across Capacitor Z: Increases

content.answer: Voltage across Capacitor Y: DecreasesVoltage across Capacitor Z: Increases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
